contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} '''Ear tuft''' is a [[mutation]] found in the [[Araucana]] [[chicken]] [[breed]]. It causes a skin projection covered in feathers to appear on the sides of the head near the ears. It could be said chickens with this trait appear to have [[Pompon|pom-poms]] stuck on their heads. This mutation is a [[inherited disorder|dominant semi-lethal]]. ==About== Ear tufts are a very unusual and difficult to breed. Most Araucanas are hatched without tufts. Ear tufts are scientifically said to have come from a dominant and lethal gene. Judges of this breed of chickens focus on theirs tufts and rumplessness. Type and color are judged as secondary considerations.<ref name="Ear tuft">{{cite web|title=Araucanas by Alan Stanford, Ph.D from the June/July, 2007 issue of Backyard Poulty|url=http://www.backyardpoultrymag.com/issues/2/2-3/Alan_Stanford.html|publisher=Backyard Poultry|accessdate=12 February 2013}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ear Tuft}} [[Category:Feathers]] [[Category:Chicken]] {{Poultry-stub}}
